snippet.textDisplay: It seems like it would be difficult to keep up with your surroundings if you are constantly teleporting during combat. Even a low frame rate can make it hard to keep up with your surroundings in a fast-paced situation, so personally, I can't imagine teleporting around the battlefield to be enjoyable. Other than that, everything else seems pretty good.
snippet.textOriginal: It seems like it would be difficult to keep up with your surroundings if you are constantly teleporting during combat. Even a low frame rate can make it hard to keep up with your surroundings in a fast-paced situation, so personally, I can't imagine teleporting around the battlefield to be enjoyable. Other than that, everything else seems pretty good.

snippet.textDisplay: So it’s just a ramped up version of the Aerosmith arcade game, but with the Half Life universe. I would be sold on this if it were a true half life game where you could move your character around freely. I hate the movement in this game already. The shooting and covering and reloading is very cool. But it’s more VR gimmicks. It’s getting there, just not yet. I just wanted a new half-life game with a controller.
snippet.textOriginal: So it’s just a ramped up version of the Aerosmith arcade game, but with the Half Life universe. I would be sold on this if it were a true half life game where you could move your character around freely. I hate the movement in this game already. The shooting and covering and reloading is very cool. But it’s more VR gimmicks. It’s getting there, just not yet. I just wanted a new half-life game with a controller.

snippet.textDisplay:
I commend Valve for putting so much faith in VR but.... No one else has.
I need more than one AAA title to blow that much cash on a new system.
It is a shame really but to be honest VR isnt there yet. I suspect VR wont be competing against the big boys for atleast 10 years.


What I am waiting for is when you put a helmet o or sensor on your temple n and the helmet/sensors can translate messages from your brain. (e.g. think forward character moves forward)

The technology exists at the moment but it is primitive.
snippet.textOriginal:
I commend Valve for putting so much faith in VR but.... No one else has.
I need more than one AAA title to blow that much cash on a new system.
It is a shame really but to be honest VR isnt there yet.  I suspect VR wont be competing against the big boys for atleast 10 years.


What I am waiting for is when you put a helmet o or sensor on your temple n and the helmet/sensors can translate messages from your brain. (e.g. think forward character moves forward) 

The technology exists at the moment but it is primitive.

snippet.textDisplay: I'm gutted... Half life has always been my favourite story.... I've waited ages like everyone else...visually it looks great.. Not stunning, but great,.. But the gameplay looks clumsy, as anyone trying to use vr at speed would expect... I just don't think this is the game to use it on... Maybe it's valves plan. Shut everyone up asking for hl3, by killing the franchise...
snippet.textOriginal: I'm gutted... Half life has always been my favourite story.... I've waited ages like everyone else...visually it looks great.. Not stunning, but great,.. But the gameplay looks clumsy, as anyone trying to use vr at speed would expect... I just don't think this is the game to use it on... Maybe it's valves plan. Shut everyone up asking for hl3, by killing the franchise...

snippet.textDisplay:
There's couple of strange things in the game.
1. Speaking protagonist is unusual for funs of the series. I understand that Alyx was speakign in Half-Life 2 and episodes, but it's still unusual.
2. What's wrong with the AI? On 1:08 his teammate was just blown up and he's like "Nothing happened. Keep looking in the different direction".
3. About the equipment. I think developers should explain why after events of Half-Life: Alyx some of the equipment were changed or disappeared in Half-Life 2.
snippet.textOriginal:
There's couple of strange things in the game.
1. Speaking protagonist is unusual for funs of the series. I understand that Alyx was speakign in Half-Life 2 and episodes, but it's still unusual.
2. What's wrong with the AI? On 1:08 his teammate was just blown up and he's like "Nothing happened. Keep looking in the different direction".
3. About the equipment. I think developers should explain why after events of Half-Life: Alyx some of the equipment were changed or disappeared in Half-Life 2.
